{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.20554v1", "title": "Small brains but big challenges: white matter tractography in early life
  samples", "summary": "In the human brain, white matter development is a complex and long-lasting
process involving intermingling micro-and macrostructural mechanisms, such as
fiber growth, pruning and myelination. Did you know that all these
neurodevelopmental changes strongly affect MRI signals, with consequences on
tractography performances and reliability? This communication aims to elaborate
on these aspects, highlighting the importance of tracking and studying the
developing connections with dedicated approaches.", "main_category": "q-bio.NC", "categories": "q-bio.NC", "published": "2025-04-29T08:56:21Z"}
